content: any idea when the r4 test server will be back up?
http://test.fhir.org/r4/
server looked ok but it wasn't working - restarted it
@Grahame Grieve http://test.fhir.org/r4 seems to be down again (Access violation at address 0000000000B74B87 in module 'FHIRServer.exe'. Read of address 0000000000000028).
try again? looks ok to me?
I get the same error on 2 different browsers
ok restarting. try again in a few minutes
It works now. Thank you!
the test.fhir.org servers are down again. @Grahame Grieve
ok thx
@Grahame Grieve, http://test.fhir.org/r4 seems to be down (Access violation at address 0000000003740B70 in module 'FHIRServer.exe'. Read of address 0000000000000080).
@Grahame Grieve, http://test.fhir.org/r4 is still down with a new error "No Database Connections Available for "fhir" (used: InUse 100 of 100: Operation 3 days..."
ok restarting
ty
@Grahame Grieve, it seems to be still (or again?) down with an old error "Access violation at address 0000000003740B70 in module 'FHIRServer.exe'. Read of address 0000000000000080"
well, I'll restart again...
Hi @Grahame Grieve, I suspect either the database or the app might get corrupted: even after restarts, the FHIR server keeps returning an "Access violation" error.
hmm I'll have a look
@Grahame Grieve http://test.fhir.org/r4 is down with - Access violation at address 0000000000BFEFA7 in module 'FHIRServer.exe'. Read of address 0000000000000028
This is down again. (And http://test.fhir.org/r3 and http://test.fhir.org/r2 are in Spanish, not that that is an issue, but not what I expected!)
someone is doing something to upset the server. It's on my list...

HTTP 500 when posting a transaction: [SQL Server]The INSERT statement conflicted with the FOREIGN KEY constraint \\"FK_ClosureEntries_ConceptKey\\". The conflict occurred in database \\"fhir4\\", table \\"dbo.Closures\\", column \'ClosureKey\'.</p></div>"},"issue" : [{"severity" : "error","details" : {"text" : "[Microsoft][SQL Server Native Client 11.0][SQL Server]The INSERT statement conflicted with the FOREIGN KEY constraint \\"FK_ClosureEntries_ConceptKey\\". The conflict occurred in database \\"fhir4\\", table \\"dbo.Closures\\", column \'ClosureKey\'."},"diagnostics" : "(0000000000D51004){FHIRServer.exe} [0000000001152004] Unknown function at TMethodImplementationIntercept + $CA9994\\r\\n(0000000005AE1BAC){FHIRServer.exe} [0000000005EE2BAC] Unknown function at TMethodImplementationIntercep
this is reproducible?
yes. Still happens, when posting the same transaction. I'll DM it to you.
